reviewText: Years before the Beats arrived in San Francisco, the city exploded with artistic expressions - painting, theatre, film, poetry. And at its center was the groundbreaking filmmaker and poet James Broughton. His remarkable story spans the post-war San Francisco Renaissance, escape to Europe during the McCarthy years, his special film prize at Cannes, his consorting with the Beats, making films celebrating the human body, meeting his soulmate at age 61, writing the book Making Light of It, becoming a bard of Gay liberation, and dying a conscious death in 1999.
